authors.headline: Inspecteur Primair Onderwijs bij Inspectie van het Onderwijs

profile_positions.description:
Working closely with both the Humanitarian and Education teams, providing direction to Save the Children Norway’s Education in Emergencies work, including taking forward the EiE strategy, leading the programme development, supporting monitoring, evaluation and learning, and engaging in internal and external networking and coordination:

- Lead the education team in strategic thinking around EiE, defining key priorities and activities and taking forward strategic plans.
- Be the focal point for SCN’s EiE work, internally and externally, and technically lead the EiE team in prioritizing efforts
- Develop and maintain a detailed work plan for strategic objectives and programme development, particularly focusing on (1) improving measurability of EiE programming, (2) linking EiE programming to longer term development education programmes, (3) increasing focus on achieving a Quality Learning Environment for EiE contexts, and (4) designing and operationalizing the Safe Schools approach.
- Support development of proposals for EiE funding, with particular focus on strategic funding initiatives (e.g. Framework Agreement with the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs).
- Backstopping support to selected countries in the SCN funding portfolio, as well as in the SCI portfolio, including field visits when required. In particular, supporting the EiE responses in Syria, Yemen, Turkey and Ukraine.  
- Represent SCN and the wider SCI EiE community by co-leading the Education in Emergencies Working Group, and regularly attending relevant internal and external meetings (Education Global Theme, Education Global Cluster, Humanitarian Technical Working Group, etc.).
- Support the recruitment, capacity building and deployment allocations of the EiE roving staff. 
- Work closely with the SCN advocacy team to formulate key messages around EiE and priorities for advocacy, such as the work around the Education Crisis Platform, increased financing for EiE, and Protecting Education from Attack.
profile_positions.title: Senior Education in Emergencies Advisor

profile_positions.description: This is a voluntary position for one afternoon a week. As TeamUp facilitator I am part of a team responsible for organizing and facilitating recreational activities for children in the asylum seeker centre (AZC) in Utrecht. The children are between 6 and 18 years old, I am particularly focusing on those children between 6 and 11 years old.
profile_positions.title: TeamUp Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
Deployments as the lead technical adviser in a small or medium-sized emergency, 2nd phase of a large emergency, or as a field level technical coordinator in a complex, large-scale emergency:
- Lead on sectoral assessment, programme design and master-budgeting, coordination (including Cluster)
- Support fundraising, recruitment and procurement liaising, linking with other sectors.
- Mentor and/or capacity build existing country programme staff. 

Continuing as:
September 2013 - April 2014: Education Technical Manager - Northern Syria Response
Overall responsible for planning, preparing and overseeing implementation of the education programmes in Northern Syria, including management of grants and work plans, oversight of budgets, supervision of education staff and partners implementing the programme, and coordination with other actors and stakeholders

May 2014 - November 2015: Education in Emergencies Specialist - South Sudan
- Leading on the overall EiE programme development, securing funding for continuation and expansion of the programme responding to the crisis after December 2013.
- Planning and management of the EiE activities, with a particular focus on Northern Jonglei state (Akobo and Waat; opposition held areas).
- Capacity building of field staff in the delivery of EiE activities in the changed context, with large influx of internally displaced persons (IDPs) into the operational area.

December 2014 – February 2015: Unpaid leave
- Research project for Open University UK linked to Save the Children EiE Working Group and Global Education Cluster research agenda: ‘Bridging the gap between humanitarian and development programming; in what ways might sustainability of education approaches be enhanced beyond the response phase?’

March 2015 - May 2015: Education Programme Advisor - Syria Response
Overall responsible for programme development and quality of the education programme in Northern Syria
profile_positions.title: Emergency Response Personnel - Education Adviser

profile_positions.description:
Deployments as field level technical coordinator in a medium or large scale emergency, plus lead technical adviser in a small emergency:
-	Lead on sectoral assessment, project planning, coordination (including the Cluster) 
-	Support fundraising, recruitment and procurement, usually at a Provincial or sub-national level 
-	Mentor and/or capacity build existing country programme staff

November 2012 – March 2013: Education Rapid Needs Assessment – Myanmar (Rakhine State) 
Leading the education needs assessment of primary and secondary school age children within the IDP camps and returnee locations in Sittwe township, in coordination with UNICEF, and presenting  recommendations for a strategic way forward for the broader emergency education response, and for Save the Children International in particular.

April 2013 - August 2013: Education Advisor - Afghanistan
- Education Cluster Coordinator, and advisory support for Save the Children in education in emergencies; developing a plan for the future direction for national coordination of education in emergencies, including capacity building and response.
- Senior Education Programme Manager; Technical and management support to the delivery of Save the Children's education portfolio at a critical start-up phase for the new STAGES grant (Steps Towards Afghan Girls' Education Success) of DfID; developing and coordinating detailed implementation plans, establishing an effective MEAL system, coordinating the development of standardised tools and packages, managing relationships with consortium partners. 

September 2013 - April 2014: Education Technical Manager - Northern Syria response
Overall responsible for planning, preparing and overseeing implementation of the education programmes in Northern Syria, including management of grants and work plans, oversight of budgets, supervision of education staff and partners implementing the programme, and coordination with other actors and stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Emergency Response Personnel - Education Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
-	Planning, monitoring and coordination of the Special and Inclusive Education component in four project areas (13 provinces)
-	Coordination, monitoring and evaluation of a 30-month EC-funded project regarding Special & Inclusive Education, Community Mobilization & Advocacy, and Employment Support 
-	Developing programme-wide project proposals, donor applications & donor reports
-	Capacity building of counterpart, field staff and (local) government employees by providing training, coaching, follow-up and support-on-the-job 
-	Participate in internal and national Inclusive Education Working Groups, in liaison with Ministry of Education and Ministry of Labour, Social Affairs, Martyrs and Disabled
-	Represent SCA on Education conferences and meetings, such as Community Based Rehabilitation, Community Based Education, National Strategic Education Planning
-	Successful proposal submission to ensure additional SIDA funds for physical rehabilitation and the roll-out of inclusive education services in 2012 and 2013
-	Developing Terms of References for vacancies and consultancies, data collection and analysis for surveys, member of job interview panel, networking and liaising in ministries and other organizations, representing the disability and education programme in strategic meetings, advising and follow-up on budget allocations and revisions
profile_positions.title: Special and Inclusive Education Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Working at the Centre for Rehabilitation and Inclusive Education for Children with Disabilities, Cao Bang Town, Cao Bang Province, Vietnam. 
Supporting the Education project for the Medical Committee Netherlands Vietnam

-	Coordinating with donor and implementers of the project, including government authorities
-	Developing and implementing the strategic plan for the operation of the Centre
-	Capacity building of teachers and staff of the Department of Education and Training
profile_positions.title: Inclusive Education Advisor

company.name: De Burcht: School for Special Education

profile_positions.company: De Burcht: School for Special Education
profile_positions.description:
- Consults with teachers, parents and school personnel about learning, social and behaviour problems
- Developing and organizing individualized education programs, counselling children, observing children
- Administering intelligence, personality and achievement tests
- Advising in referrals to other forms of education
profile_positions.title: Educational Counsellor / Educational Psychologist

profile_positions.description:
- Coaching on organizing educational care, consulting with teachers, parents and school personnel about learning, social and behaviour problems
- Developing and leading workshops and trainings, on various education topics, such as dyscalculia, interaction between teachers and students, social-emotional and cognitive development of children
- Supporting school teams in implementing new curricula
- Administering intelligence, personality and achievement tests to assess and diagnose children’s problems and strengths
profile_positions.title: Innovation and Organization Advisor (Educational Counsellor)
